name: cathode production, NMC111, for Li-ion battery | cathode, NMC111, for Li-ion battery | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24765/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg nickel-manganese-cobalt (NMC) cathode for Li-ion batteries,  with nickel manganese and cobalt in ratio 1:1:1 (NMC111). Data are based on literature and expert judgement. For infrastructure, the ecoinvent dataset "chemical factory, organics" is accounted. 

The activity starts when NMC111 oxide and other materials enter the process at the factory.

The activity ends with the production of NMC111 cathode at factory gate.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/272:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators/2720:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2017 (year of the publication of data) and 2020 (year of the dataset)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The demand of energy in this dataset come from large-scale industrial production companies located in China and are assumed to be representative of the production of NMC111 cathode in China.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The positive electrode is made of a transition metal oxide (Li-NMC oxide), a conductive additive (carbon black) and a polymer binder (polyvinylidene fluoride, PVDF) mixed in ratio 95:2.5:2.5. The solvent N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone (NMP) is used to prepare the cathode slurry. The input materials are mixed to form a slurry, then the mixture is dried with the solvent evaporating away, cut and calendered to form the cathode of a Li-ion battery.  The energy required to coat the aluminium conductor foil with the cathode slurry is included in this dataset, because it was not possible to separate it from the energy required for the drying step.

flow.name: cathode, NMC111, for Li-ion battery
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/272:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators/2720:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. For this activity, no information was readily available concerning infrastructure and land-use. Therefore, the infrastructure is estimated based on data from two chemical factories, the BASF site of Ludwigshafen and the chemical factory in Gendorf (which are both located in Germany), which produce a wide range of chemical substances. Based on this data, the following assumptions are made: the built area amounts to about 4.2 ha, the plant has an average output of 50'000 t/a and a lifespan of fifty years. The estimated infrastructure amount is therefore 4.00 E-10 units per kg of produced chemical. 
References: 
Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH. 
Gendorf (2000) Umwelterklärung 2000, Werk Gendorf. Werk Gendorf, Burgkirchen.om ecoinvent)

exchanges.description:
Literature. Original value of 56-71 MJ/kWh cell taken from Dai et al. (2017), representing the energy demand for electrode drying & NMP recovery. It refers to 43Ah, 3.7 V NMC cells. This value is calculated considering the average energy demand, the storage capacity per NMC111 cell (0.167 kWh/cell according to Dai et al., 2019) and the share of cathode in the cell. 

Reference:
Dai et al. (2017). Update of Life Cycle Analysis of Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. ArgonneNational Laboratory.
Dai et al. (2019). Life cycle analysis of lithium-ion batteries for automotive applications. Batteries, 5(2), 48.

exchanges.description: Calculated value to obtain mass balance.

Calculated value based on Pettinger & Dong (2016). Specifically, this value results from summing the energy demand for cathode slurry preparation with NMP-based solvent, slitting and calendaring, in terms of kWh electricity per cell (0.331 kWh/cell). Original value refers to a 40 Ah, 3.7 V generic Li-ion battery. The specific energy capacity of NMC  cell is 0.197 kWh/kg cell (Dai et al. 2019)

Reference:
Pettinger, K. H., & Dong, W. (2016). When does the operation of a battery become environmentally positive?. Journal of The Electrochemical Society, 164(1), A6274.
Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Gaines, L., & Wang, M. (2019). Life cycle analysis of lithium-ion batteries for automotive applications. Batteries, 5(2), 48.

exchanges.description:
Based on literature. NMP is used as a solvent in the production of NMC cathode. Approximately 98% NMP is recovered via evaporation for re-use in the production of cathode material (Emilson, E., & Dahllöf, L., 2019. Lithium‐Ion Vehicle Battery Production. IVL Technical Report). 

Reference: 
Cloutier, Julie, 2015. Est-ce que le stockage d’énergie au Québec pourrait être avantageux d’un point de vue environnemental? Analyse du cycle de vie attributionnelle et conséquentielle. MSc. Env. Dissertation, University of Sherbrooke. Available at: https://www.usherbrooke.ca/environnement/fileadmin/sites/environnement/documents/Essais_2015/Cloutier_Julie_MEnv_2015.pdf
